### FindLoopCounter() {#adc183a6edc37f305ee9ca5ff0bc33a6e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static PHINode &#42; FindLoopCounter (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42; L, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; ExitingBB, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; BECount, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &#42; SE, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dominatortree">DominatorTree</a> &#42; DT)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Search the loop header for a loop counter (anadd rec w/step of one) suitable for use by LFTR.

If multiple counters are available, select the &quot;best&quot; one based profitable heuristics.

BECount may be an i8&#42; pointer type. The pointer difference is already valid count without scaling the address stride, so it remains a pointer expression as far as <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> is concerned.

<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// computations derived from them) into simpler forms suitable for subsequent</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// analysis and transformation.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the trip count of a loop is computable, this pass also makes the following</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// changes:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   1 The exit condition for the loop is canonicalized to compare the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      induction value against the exit value.  This turns loops like:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        &#39;for (i = 7; i&#42;i &lt; 1000; ++i)&#39; into &#39;for (i = 0; i != 25; ++i)&#39;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   2 Any use outside of the loop of an expression derived from the indvar</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      is changed to compute the derived value outside of the loop, eliminating</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      the dependence on the exit value of the induction variable.  If the only</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      purpose of the loop is to compute the exit value of some derived</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      expression, this transformation will make the loop dead.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If the loop has floating induction variable then insert corresponding</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><Highlight kind="comment">/// integer induction variable if possible.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><Highlight kind="comment">/// For example,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><Highlight kind="comment">/// for(double i = 0; i &lt; 10000; ++i)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><Highlight kind="comment">///   bar(i)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><Highlight kind="comment">/// is converted into</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><Highlight kind="comment">/// for(int i = 0; i &lt; 10000; ++i)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><Highlight kind="comment">///   bar((double)i);</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IndVarSimplify::handleFloatingPointIV(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42;L, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phinode">PHINode</a> &#42;PN) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check incoming value.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;InitValueVal = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;ConstantFP&gt;</a>(PN-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phinode/#aca1fd00f3ab63ec8f0f1ccc2093a9f6d">getIncomingValue</a>(IncomingEdge));</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check IV increment. Reject this PN if increment operation is not</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// an add or increment value can not be represented by an integer.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;Incr = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;BinaryOperator&gt;</a>(PN-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phinode/#aca1fd00f3ab63ec8f0f1ccc2093a9f6d">getIncomingValue</a>(BackEdge));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Incr == </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> || Incr-&gt;getOpcode() != Instruction::FAdd) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If this is not an add of the PHI with a constantfp, or if the constant fp</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantfp">ConstantFP</a> &#42;IncValueVal = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;ConstantFP&gt;</a>(Incr-&gt;getOperand(1));</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the stride would wrap around the i32 before exiting, we can&#39;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// transform the IV.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Leftover != 0 &amp;&amp; int32&#95;t(ExitValue+IncValue) &lt; ExitValue)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If we have a negative stride, we require the init to be greater than the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// exit value.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (InitValue &lt;= ExitValue)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><Highlight kind="normal">    uint32&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmintrrange-cpp/#a34bd74317e3f04bfc4318c2d1a470877">Range</a> = uint32&#95;t(InitValue-ExitValue);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check for infinite loop, either:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// while (i &gt;= Exit) or until (i &lt; Exit)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (NewPred == <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78bac1aa7b798ba11d2e497d5cce6ce6d3dc">CmpInst::ICMP&#95;SGE</a> || NewPred == <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba15ae464950ac676919c2f0c7aafc706c">CmpInst::ICMP&#95;SLT</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (++<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmintrrange-cpp/#a34bd74317e3f04bfc4318c2d1a470877">Range</a> == 0) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Range overflows.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Leftover = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmintrrange-cpp/#a34bd74317e3f04bfc4318c2d1a470877">Range</a> % uint32&#95;t(-IncValue);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="427"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// rewriteFirstIterationLoopExitValues: Rewrite loop exit values if we know</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="428"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// they will exit at the first iteration.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="523"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the narrow induction variable, and thus can end up being narrower than the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00524" /><CodeLine lineNumber="524"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &quot;narrow&quot; induction variable.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00525" /><CodeLine lineNumber="525"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint64&#95;t NarrowIVWidth = SE-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a2c96114e89e8cf2122ebe8bc4d929c7c">getTypeSizeInBits</a>(WI.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/wideivinfo/#a882fc540d5e5234ddf6a9f880e3f5a9b">NarrowIV</a>-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#a0344a49526443edf90cc0aef3abd3337">getType</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00528" /><CodeLine lineNumber="528"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00529" /><CodeLine lineNumber="529"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Cast is either an sext or zext up to this point.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="530"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We should not widen an indvar if arithmetics on the wider indvar are more</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="531"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// expensive than those on the narrower indvar. We check only the cost of ADD</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00532" /><CodeLine lineNumber="532"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// because at least an ADD is required to increment the induction variable. We</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="533"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// could compute more comprehensively the cost of all instructions on the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00534" /><CodeLine lineNumber="534"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// induction variable when necessary.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="535"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa0d69e81725c10fa5407f0bf34462068">TTI</a> &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="539"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="540"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="541"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00605" /><CodeLine lineNumber="605"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="606"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Each round of simplification iterates through the SimplifyIVUsers worklist</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="607"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for all current phis, then determines whether any IVs can be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="608"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// widened. Widening adds new phis to LoopPhis, inducing another round of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="609"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// simplification on the wide IVs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="610"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/groups/arcopt/#gaa57b1a4e6a1c79233913139635169cf1">Changed</a> = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="611"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">while</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!LoopPhis.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatecommon/#ad9a3c7bc26b130377bbafc170b5f88a2">empty</a>()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="612"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Evaluate as many IV expressions as possible before widening any IVs. This</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00613" /><CodeLine lineNumber="613"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// forces SCEV to set no-wrap flags before evaluating sign/zero</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="614"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// extension. The first time SCEV attempts to normalize sign/zero extension,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00615" /><CodeLine lineNumber="615"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the result becomes final. So for the most predictable results, we delay</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00616" /><CodeLine lineNumber="616"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// evaluation of sign/zero extend evaluation until needed, and avoid running</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="617"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// other SCEV based analysis prior to simplifyAndExtend.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00658" /><CodeLine lineNumber="658"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Given an Value which is hoped to be part of an add recurance in the given</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00861" /><CodeLine lineNumber="861"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Avoid reusing a potentially undef value to compute other values that may</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00863" /><CodeLine lineNumber="863"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!<a href="#a9cc6c5ed9edaa15e526e2a5ad24d1413">hasConcreteDef</a>(Phi)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00864" /><CodeLine lineNumber="864"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We explicitly allow unknown phis as long as they are already used by</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00865" /><CodeLine lineNumber="865"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the loop exit test.  This is legal since performing LFTR could not</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00866" /><CodeLine lineNumber="866"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// increase the number of undef users.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00867" /><CodeLine lineNumber="867"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;IncPhi = Phi-&gt;getIncomingValueForBlock(LatchBlock);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00868" /><CodeLine lineNumber="868"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!<a href="#a23d78b7d4dbea0ecc84dc55313ad1f25">isLoopExitTestBasedOn</a>(Phi, ExitingBB) &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00869" /><CodeLine lineNumber="869"><Highlight kind="normal">          !<a href="#a23d78b7d4dbea0ecc84dc55313ad1f25">isLoopExitTestBasedOn</a>(IncPhi, ExitingBB))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00870" /><CodeLine lineNumber="870"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">continue</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00871" /><CodeLine lineNumber="871"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00872" /><CodeLine lineNumber="872"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00873" /><CodeLine lineNumber="873"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Avoid introducing undefined behavior due to poison which didn&#39;t exist in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00874" /><CodeLine lineNumber="874"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the original program.  (Annoyingly, the rules for poison and undef</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00875" /><CodeLine lineNumber="875"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// propagation are distinct, so this does NOT cover the undef case above.)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00876" /><CodeLine lineNumber="876"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We have to ensure that we don&#39;t introduce UB by introducing a use on an</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00877" /><CodeLine lineNumber="877"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// iteration where said IV produces poison.  Our strategy here differs for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00878" /><CodeLine lineNumber="878"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// pointers and integer IVs.  For integers, we strip and reinfer as needed,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00879" /><CodeLine lineNumber="879"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// see code in linearFunctionTestReplace.  For pointers, we restrict</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00880" /><CodeLine lineNumber="880"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// transforms as there is no good way to reinfer inbounds once lost.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00881" /><CodeLine lineNumber="881"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!Phi-&gt;getType()-&gt;isIntegerTy() &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00882" /><CodeLine lineNumber="882"><Highlight kind="normal">        !<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a023f82db84f5e5ed13398308496689e7">mustExecuteUBIfPoisonOnPathTo</a>(Phi, ExitingBB-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#aef9e9fcf4c5dfce90276ca16d91b8e46">getTerminator</a>(), DT))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00883" /><CodeLine lineNumber="883"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">continue</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00884" /><CodeLine lineNumber="884"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00885" /><CodeLine lineNumber="885"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/init">Init</a> = AR-&gt;getStart();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00886" /><CodeLine lineNumber="886"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00887" /><CodeLine lineNumber="887"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (BestPhi &amp;&amp; !<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aca57f75a6554ba9ed3bc72ef7b7540de">isAlmostDeadIV</a>(BestPhi, LatchBlock, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvredundantcopyelimination-cpp/#a193847098793cdbab306803186676899">Cond</a>)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00888" /><CodeLine lineNumber="888"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Don&#39;t force a live loop counter if another IV can be used.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00889" /><CodeLine lineNumber="889"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aca57f75a6554ba9ed3bc72ef7b7540de">isAlmostDeadIV</a>(Phi, LatchBlock, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvredundantcopyelimination-cpp/#a193847098793cdbab306803186676899">Cond</a>))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00890" /><CodeLine lineNumber="890"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">continue</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00891" /><CodeLine lineNumber="891"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00892" /><CodeLine lineNumber="892"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Prefer to count-from-zero. This is a more &quot;canonical&quot; counter form. It</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00893" /><CodeLine lineNumber="893"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// also prefers integer to pointer IVs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00894" /><CodeLine lineNumber="894"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (BestInit-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#a4541962f9c18aacceb7243520eb15e1f">isZero</a>() != <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/init">Init</a>-&gt;isZero()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00895" /><CodeLine lineNumber="895"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (BestInit-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#a4541962f9c18aacceb7243520eb15e1f">isZero</a>())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00896" /><CodeLine lineNumber="896"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">continue</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00897" /><CodeLine lineNumber="897"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00898" /><CodeLine lineNumber="898"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If two IVs both count from zero or both count from nonzero then the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00899" /><CodeLine lineNumber="899"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// narrower is likely a dead phi that has been widened. Use the wider phi</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00900" /><CodeLine lineNumber="900"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to allow the other to be eliminated.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00901" /><CodeLine lineNumber="901"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (PhiWidth &lt;= SE-&gt;getTypeSizeInBits(BestPhi-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#a0344a49526443edf90cc0aef3abd3337">getType</a>()))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00902" /><CodeLine lineNumber="902"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">continue</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00903" /><CodeLine lineNumber="903"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00904" /><CodeLine lineNumber="904"><Highlight kind="normal">    BestPhi = Phi;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00905" /><CodeLine lineNumber="905"><Highlight kind="normal">    BestInit = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/init">Init</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00906" /><CodeLine lineNumber="906"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00941" /><CodeLine lineNumber="941"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00942" /><CodeLine lineNumber="942"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This method rewrites the exit condition of the loop to be a canonical !=</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00943" /><CodeLine lineNumber="943"><Highlight kind="comment">/// comparison against the incremented loop induction variable.  This pass is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00944" /><CodeLine lineNumber="944"><Highlight kind="comment">/// able to rewrite the exit tests of any loop where the SCEV analysis can</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00945" /><CodeLine lineNumber="945"><Highlight kind="comment">/// determine a loop-invariant trip count of the loop, which is actually a much</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00946" /><CodeLine lineNumber="946"><Highlight kind="comment">/// broader range than just linear tests.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00947" /><CodeLine lineNumber="947"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IndVarSimplify::</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00948" /><CodeLine lineNumber="948"><Highlight kind="normal">linearFunctionTestReplace(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42;L, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;ExitingBB,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00949" /><CodeLine lineNumber="949"><Highlight kind="normal">                          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;ExitCount,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00950" /><CodeLine lineNumber="950"><Highlight kind="normal">                          <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phinode">PHINode</a> &#42;IndVar, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevexpander">SCEVExpander</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/virtregmap-cpp/#a1ad52109a2ff430460c8776286b97b2e">Rewriter</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00951" /><CodeLine lineNumber="951"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ead20caec3b48a1eef164cb4ca81ba2587">L</a>-&gt;getLoopLatch() &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Loop no longer in simplified form?&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00952" /><CodeLine lineNumber="952"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(<a href="#a7803cd22b4405090d0cb0b87d697a612">isLoopCounter</a>(IndVar, L, SE));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00953" /><CodeLine lineNumber="953"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IncVar =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00954" /><CodeLine lineNumber="954"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac4fc845f5ed92de63cd4474f128f5fc5">cast&lt;Instruction&gt;</a>(IndVar-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phinode/#ab2db7609ec72b1af2f91d47e40dc3722">getIncomingValueForBlock</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ead20caec3b48a1eef164cb4ca81ba2587">L</a>-&gt;getLoopLatch()));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00955" /><CodeLine lineNumber="955"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00956" /><CodeLine lineNumber="956"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Initialize CmpIndVar to the preincremented IV.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00957" /><CodeLine lineNumber="957"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;CmpIndVar = IndVar;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00958" /><CodeLine lineNumber="958"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> UsePostInc = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00959" /><CodeLine lineNumber="959"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00960" /><CodeLine lineNumber="960"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the exiting block is the same as the backedge block, we prefer to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00961" /><CodeLine lineNumber="961"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// compare against the post-incremented value, otherwise we must compare</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00962" /><CodeLine lineNumber="962"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// against the preincremented value.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00963" /><CodeLine lineNumber="963"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (ExitingBB == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ead20caec3b48a1eef164cb4ca81ba2587">L</a>-&gt;getLoopLatch()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00964" /><CodeLine lineNumber="964"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For pointer IVs, we chose to not strip inbounds which requires us not</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00965" /><CodeLine lineNumber="965"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to add a potentially UB introducing use.  We need to either a) show</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00966" /><CodeLine lineNumber="966"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the loop test we&#39;re modifying is already in post-inc form, or b) show</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00967" /><CodeLine lineNumber="967"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that adding a use must not introduce UB.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00968" /><CodeLine lineNumber="968"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SafeToPostInc =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00969" /><CodeLine lineNumber="969"><Highlight kind="normal">        IndVar-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#a0344a49526443edf90cc0aef3abd3337">getType</a>()-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type/#ac6d28a9b11139182134a9618028a0d07">isIntegerTy</a>() ||</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00970" /><CodeLine lineNumber="970"><Highlight kind="normal">        <a href="#a23d78b7d4dbea0ecc84dc55313ad1f25">isLoopExitTestBasedOn</a>(IncVar, ExitingBB) ||</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00971" /><CodeLine lineNumber="971"><Highlight kind="normal">        <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a023f82db84f5e5ed13398308496689e7">mustExecuteUBIfPoisonOnPathTo</a>(IncVar, ExitingBB-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#aef9e9fcf4c5dfce90276ca16d91b8e46">getTerminator</a>(), DT);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00972" /><CodeLine lineNumber="972"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (SafeToPostInc) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00973" /><CodeLine lineNumber="973"><Highlight kind="normal">      UsePostInc = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00974" /><CodeLine lineNumber="974"><Highlight kind="normal">      CmpIndVar = IncVar;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00975" /><CodeLine lineNumber="975"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00976" /><CodeLine lineNumber="976"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00977" /><CodeLine lineNumber="977"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00978" /><CodeLine lineNumber="978"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It may be necessary to drop nowrap flags on the incrementing instruction</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00979" /><CodeLine lineNumber="979"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// if either LFTR moves from a pre-inc check to a post-inc check (in which</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00980" /><CodeLine lineNumber="980"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// case the increment might have previously been poison on the last iteration</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00981" /><CodeLine lineNumber="981"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// only) or if LFTR switches to a different IV that was previously dynamically</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00982" /><CodeLine lineNumber="982"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// dead (and as such may be arbitrarily poison). We remove any nowrap flags</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00983" /><CodeLine lineNumber="983"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that SCEV didn&#39;t infer for the post-inc addrec (even if we use a pre-inc</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00984" /><CodeLine lineNumber="984"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// check), because the pre-inc addrec flags may be adopted from the original</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00985" /><CodeLine lineNumber="985"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instruction, while SCEV has to explicitly prove the post-inc nowrap flags.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00986" /><CodeLine lineNumber="986"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: This handling is inaccurate for one case: If we switch to a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00987" /><CodeLine lineNumber="987"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// dynamically dead IV that wraps on the first loop iteration only, which is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00988" /><CodeLine lineNumber="988"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// not covered by the post-inc addrec. (If the new IV was not dynamically</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00989" /><CodeLine lineNumber="989"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// dead, it could not be poison on the first iteration in the first place.)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00990" /><CodeLine lineNumber="990"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;BO = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;BinaryOperator&gt;</a>(IncVar)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00991" /><CodeLine lineNumber="991"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevaddrecexpr">SCEVAddRecExpr</a> &#42;AR = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac4fc845f5ed92de63cd4474f128f5fc5">cast&lt;SCEVAddRecExpr&gt;</a>(SE-&gt;getSCEV(IncVar));</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1424"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note: This is duplicating a particular part on SimplifyIndVars reasoning.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1425"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We need to duplicate it because given icmp zext(small-iv), C, IVUsers</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1426"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// never reaches the icmp since the zext doesn&#39;t fold to an AddRec unless</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1427"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// it already has flags.  The alternative to this would be to extending the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1428"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// set of &quot;interesting&quot; IV users to include the icmp, but doing that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1429"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// regresses results in practice by querying SCEVs before trip counts which</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1430"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// rely on them which results in SCEV caching sub-optimal answers.  The</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1431"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// concern about caching sub-optimal results is why we only query SCEVs of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1432"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the loop invariant RHS here.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1513"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In general, we only rotate if we can do so without increasing the number</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1514"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// of instructions.  The exception is when we have an zext(add-rec).  The</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1523"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// replace with an icmp of the form icmp unsigned-cond Op, trunc(RHS)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1530"><Highlight kind="normal">          <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ead20caec3b48a1eef164cb4ca81ba2587">L</a>-&gt;getLoopPreheader()-&gt;getTerminator()-&gt;getIterator());</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01650" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1650"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01651" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1651"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01652" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1652"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: We might have proved that we can skip the last iteration for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01653" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1653"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// this check. In this case, we only want to check the condition on the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01654" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1654"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// pre-last iteration (MaxBECount - 1). However, there is a nasty</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01655" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1655"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// corner case:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01656" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1656"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01657" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1657"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   for (i = len; i != 0; i--) &#123; ... check (i ult X) ... &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01658" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1658"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01659" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1659"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If we could not prove that len != 0, then we also could not prove that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01660" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1660"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (len - 1) is not a UINT&#95;MAX. If we simply query (len - 1), then</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01661" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1661"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// OptimizeCond will likely not prove anything for it, even if it could</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01662" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1662"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// prove the same fact for len.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01663" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1663"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01664" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1664"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// As a temporary solution, we query both last and pre-last iterations in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01665" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1665"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// hope that we will be able to prove triviality for at least one of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01666" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1666"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// them. We can stop querying MaxBECount for this case once SCEV</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01667" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1667"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// understands that (MaxBECount - 1) will not overflow here.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01668" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1668"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (OptimizeCond(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">))</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01732" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1732"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01733" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1733"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Finally, see if we can rewrite our exit conditions into a loop invariant</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01734" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1734"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// form. If we have a read-only loop, and we can tell that we must exit down</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01735" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1735"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a path which does not need any of the values computed within the loop, we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01736" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1736"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// can rewrite the loop to exit on the first iteration.  Note that this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01739" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1739"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This transformation looks a lot like a restricted form of dead loop</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01754" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1754"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01755" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1755"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> BadExit = &#91;&amp;&#93;(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;ExitingBB) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01756" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1756"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If our exiting block exits multiple loops, we can only rewrite the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01757" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1757"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// innermost one.  Otherwise, we&#39;re changing how many times the innermost</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01796" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1796"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01797" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1797"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If we have any exits which can&#39;t be predicated themselves, than we can&#39;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01798" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1798"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// predicate any exit which isn&#39;t guaranteed to execute before it.  Consider</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01799" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1799"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// two exits (a) and (b) which would both exit on the same iteration.  If we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01800" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1800"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// can predicate (b), but not (a), and (a) preceeds (b) along some path, then</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01801" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1801"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we could convert a loop from exiting through (a) to one exiting through</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01802" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1802"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (b).  Note that this problem exists only for exits with the same exit</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01803" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1803"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// count, and we could be more aggressive when exit counts are known inequal.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01804" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1804"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a74cdbd1e4f731e7d7cd83461b8b1de0b">llvm::sort</a>(ExitingBlocks, &#91;&amp;&#93;(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01806" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1806"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the normal dominance relation.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01811" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1811"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (DT-&gt;properlyDominates(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01812" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1812"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01813" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1813"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/errorhandling-h/#ace243f5c25697a1107cce46626b3dc94">llvm&#95;unreachable</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Should have total dominance order&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01814" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1814"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01815" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1815"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01816" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1816"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Make sure our exit blocks are really a total order (i.e. a linear chain of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1817"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// exits before the backedge).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01818" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1818"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> i = 1; i &lt; ExitingBlocks.size(); i++)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01819" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1819"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(DT-&gt;dominates(ExitingBlocks&#91;i - 1&#93;, ExitingBlocks&#91;i&#93;) &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01822" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1822"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Given our sorted total order, we know that exit&#91;j&#93; must be evaluated</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01823" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1823"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// after all exit&#91;i&#93; such j &gt; i.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01824" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1824"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> i = 0, e = ExitingBlocks.size(); i &lt; e; i++)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01828" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1828"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01829" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1829"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01832" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1832"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01833" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1833"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// At this point, ExitingBlocks consists of only those blocks which are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01834" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1834"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// predicatable.  Given that, we know we have at least one exit we can</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01835" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1835"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// predicate if the loop is doesn&#39;t have side effects and doesn&#39;t have any</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01836" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1836"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// implicit exits (because then our exact BTC isn&#39;t actually exact).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01837" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1837"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// @Reviewers - As structured, this is O(I^2) for loop nests.  Any</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01838" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1838"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// suggestions on how to improve this?  I can obviously bail out for outer</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01839" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1839"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// loops, but that seems less than ideal.  MemorySSA can find memory writes,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01840" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1840"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is that enough for &#42;all&#42; side effects?</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01841" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1841"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;BB : <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ead20caec3b48a1eef164cb4ca81ba2587">L</a>-&gt;blocks())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01842" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1842"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> : &#42;BB)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01843" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1843"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO:isGuaranteedToTransfer</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01844" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1844"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>.mayHaveSideEffects())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01845" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1845"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01846" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1846"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01847" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1847"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/groups/arcopt/#gaa57b1a4e6a1c79233913139635169cf1">Changed</a> = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01848" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1848"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Finally, do the actual predication for all predicatable blocks.  A couple</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01849" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1849"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// of notes here:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01850" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1850"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 1) We don&#39;t bother to constant fold dominated exits with identical exit</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01851" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1851"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    counts; that&#39;s simply a form of CSE/equality propagation and we leave</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01852" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1852"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    it for dedicated passes.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01853" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1853"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 2) We insert the comparison at the branch.  Hoisting introduces additional</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01854" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1854"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    legality constraints and we leave that to dedicated logic.  We want to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01855" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1855"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    predicate even if we can&#39;t insert a loop invariant expression as</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01856" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1856"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    peeling or unrolling will likely reduce the cost of the otherwise loop</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01857" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1857"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    varying check.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01858" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1858"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/virtregmap-cpp/#a1ad52109a2ff430460c8776286b97b2e">Rewriter</a>.setInsertPoint(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ead20caec3b48a1eef164cb4ca81ba2587">L</a>-&gt;getLoopPreheader()-&gt;getTerminator());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01859" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1859"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilder">IRBuilder&lt;&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ead20caec3b48a1eef164cb4ca81ba2587">L</a>-&gt;getLoopPreheader()-&gt;getTerminator());</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01862" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1862"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;ExitCount = SE-&gt;getExitCount(L, ExitingBB);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01983" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1983"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If our exitting block exits multiple loops, we can only rewrite the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01984" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1984"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// innermost one.  Otherwise, we&#39;re changing how many times the innermost</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01986" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1986"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (LI-&gt;getLoopFor(ExitingBB) != L)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01988" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1988"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01989" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1989"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!<a href="#a6a2f2b3d9153487f51dae119c07f8461">needsLFTR</a>(L, ExitingBB))</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01996" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1996"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This was handled above, but as we form SCEVs, we can sometimes refine</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01997" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1997"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// existing ones; this allows exit counts to be folded to zero which</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02000" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2000"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (ExitCount-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#a4541962f9c18aacceb7243520eb15e1f">isZero</a>())</Highlight></CodeLine>
